concept.title: What is Leiningen?
concept.shortdesc: Leiningen is a collection of commands that address developer tasks and needs. It depends on a kernel of core functionality, a set of plugins that implement the commands available to users, and a set of external resources - directories, files, maven repositories, etc.

conbody.p: Leiningen can be compared to Emacs. Emacs consists of a kernel of core functionality (implemented in C) made available to the user by means of commands or functions defined in Elisp, just like user-defined functions and commands. Leiningen also has a kernel of core functionality (implemented in Clojure) that is made available to users by means of plugins, which define Leiningen commands; user-defined commands are implemented in the same way.
